alert.note: Alert for Sedgwick (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 3:59PM MDT until August 02 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Logan and Sedgwick. There is a report of flooding along County Road 46, just west of highway 113 near Padroni. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 357 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sterling, Fleming, Iliff, Peetz, Crook, Proctor, Padroni, St Petersburg, Twin Buttes, North Sterling Reservoir, Reiradon Hill and Dailey.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
